intro: Sarcocarpon scandens, commonly known as the creeping sarcocarpon, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, white to yellowish flowers that appear in umbels. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often aromatic. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Sarcocarpon scandens is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies.
